page.title: 16THE BOGGS HOLDINGS
page.content: compared to a big farm of 5OO acres. Therefore the holdings had to have intensive farming. After the Second World War a lot of soft fruit- mainly strawberries were grown. There are only 5 small holdings growing fruit today.In 1964 the first holding house was sold and two fields were put together in one holding to make a more viable unit. As small holders retired they were offered 1OOO pounds to give up thier fields and a much reduced rent. Two holdings into one and sometimes made up to three. In the late 197Os the houses were modernised if the tennants requested it.The Boggs Hall was built in 1956 on a site donated by Sir David Ogilvies father.The money was raised from garden fetes held in the Boggs Farmhouse.
